New Records: Australia's second highest successful run-chase in T20Is and their highest chase against India, previously 191 at Bengaluru in 2019.
India's highest score against Australia in T20Is, previous highest was 202 at Rajkot in 2013.
India's second highest total at Mohali in T20Is after 211 against Sri Lanka in 2009.
Hardik Pandya's fastest fifty for India in T20Is, joint second fastest with Yuvraj Singh against Australia.
KL Rahul and Suryakumar Yadav's third highest third-wicket partnership for India against Australia.
Cameron Green and Steve Smith's record second-wicket partnership for Australia against India, previously 65 between Matthew Wade and Steve Smith at Sydney in 2020.
Cameron Green's second fastest fifty by an Australian batsman against India, after Matthew Wade's 25-ball half-century at Sydney in 2020.
India's 13 sixes, joint fourth most in an innings in T20Is and most against Australia, same as 13 at Bengaluru in 2019.
Key Match Events: Cameron Green's match-winning career-best 61 runs off 30 balls.
Matthew Wade's unbeaten 45 off 21 balls, Steve Smith's 35 off 24 balls, and Aaron Finch's 22 off 13 balls.
Australia's four-wicket victory, their highest against India in T20Is.
Post-Match Reflections: Cameron Green named Player of the Match.
